description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1srf2","text":"This protocol describes the steps for performing immunohistochemistry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

parent_collections.title: Nielsen and Ford (2023) M4-mediated cholinergic transmission is reduced in parkinsonian mice and its restoration alleviates motor deficits and levodopa-induced dyskinesia

creator.name: Beatriz E Nielsen
creator.affiliation: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus

related_materials.name: M.O.M.® (Mouse on Mouse) Immunodetection Kit Basic

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"735f8","text":"Prepare solutions and tools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"11sqe","text":"Remove brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aiko3","text":"Prepare cryostat:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h8ct","text":"Temperature in the chamber and at the chuck holder set to   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ljit","text":"Replace blade if needed","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aijfo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8dcd7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32onb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"brand":"Leica","can_edit":0,"file":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"guid":"4528913C341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","image":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"link":"https://www.leicabiosystems.com/histology-equipment/cryostats/","name":"Cryostat","sku":"Cryostat","specifications":null,"type":null,"vendor":{"id":416,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.leicabiosystems.com/","name":"Leica Biosystems"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94q7v","text":"Wash sections three times in 1X PBS,   each in the orbital shaker ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c60nb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8njpd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4A8B2E603E5C11EEB0D10A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"70-80","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avpb","text":"Acquire fluorescent images using a slide scanner microscope (VS120, Olympus) or confocal microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9j760","text":"Make solutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1h8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5asvk","text":"10X PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cbdj","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e8s3i","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"826ga","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"blqb8","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"alnkt","text":"Bring to   with MilliQ H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5cdlv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ecci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"948o3","text":"1X PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpl44","text":"  10X PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":10,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"59qtp","text":"  MilliQ H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":11,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"95kal","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":12,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"441r1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek39","text":"4% Paraformaldehyde (PFA) in 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1400","error_concentration":false,"guid":"805C2540E84611EC9DE9D3CD9C7AE8F1","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"410450D5341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"NaCl","mol_weight":58.44,"name":"Sodium Phosphate Monobasic","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":"P285","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":null,"vendor":{"affiliation":null,"affiliations":[],"badges":[],"blocked_by_you":false,"blocked_you":false,"hide_following":false,"id":31,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_verified_user":false,"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Fisher Scientific","note":null,"research_interests":null,"username":null,"verified":0}}},"8":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"EC638570E84711EC9DE9D3CD9C7AE8F1","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"9":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D94543C0E84711EC9DE9D3CD9C7AE8F1","id":0,"number":"7.4"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb51s","text":"Gather tools:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"173d4","text":"Perfusion tray (lid for styrofoam box) and secondary container (9\" x 13\" baking dish)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hrrh","text":"Pins or needles","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7de2k","text":"Butterfly needle","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccu2a","text":"Dissection tools (e.g. hemostat, fine scissors, decapitation scissors, forceps, spatula)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"966ul","text":"Pump ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fei9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmifu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"brand":"Fisherbrand","can_edit":1,"file":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"guid":"452B107E341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","image":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/fisher-scientific-variable-flow-peristaltic-pumps-4/p-158215","name":"Variable-Flow Peristaltic Pump","sku":"13-876-2","specifications":null,"type":null,"vendor":{"id":31,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Fisher Scientific"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"egfr8","text":"Put on ice:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9slr4","text":"1X PBS: approximately   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8v2f0","text":"4% PFA: approximately   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7e6p9","text":"5 mL or 15 mL tubes filled with 4% PFA: usually one per mouse, can put up to 3 brains in a larger tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"6B764435E84811EC84C70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"per mouse","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"755291DDE84811EC84C70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"per mouse","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ensmu","text":"Prepare pump","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"60v7i","text":"Rinse pump tubing by running 30-50 mL water through the lines","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ng5n","text":"While cleaning the lines, measure and adjust flow rate to 5 mL per minute (dial should be ~3-7 using fast and forward flow).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gue","text":"Prime the tubing with 1X PBS, running at least 10 mL through the lines; turn off flow, but keep the inlet end of the tubing in the 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcjg7","text":"Anesthetize mouse by placing it in a bell jar containing isoflurane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqrlt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f2m6","text":"Use a 15 mL tube containing isoflurane-soaked paper towels as a nose cone throughout perfusion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7rtlv","text":"Complete perfusion ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6hcum","text":"Open chest cavity and start perfusion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2aqt","text":"Place nose cone on mouse and confirm mouse is under the plane of anesthesia using a toe pinch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3cmt","text":"Lay mouse on its back on the dissection tray; pin down each foot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12el1","text":"Using a hemostat or your fingers, pull up the fur and skin in the lower half of the body, just below the sternum. Use the fine scissors to cut into the skin and make an incision across the body (left to right), being careful to not yet pierce the diaphragm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pv2p","text":"Move the skin aside to uncover the sternum and diaphragm. Grab the sternum with the hemostat and cut around the perimeter of the diaphragm and up the sides of the ribs. Be very careful to not puncture the lungs or heart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":169,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51q0c","text":"Pull rib cage towards the head and to one side to reveal the heart. If using a hemostat, keep attached to the sternum and flip it towards the mouse's head to maintain access to the chest cavity. Pins can also be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j56v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vcrh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftgk7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bqbmi","text":"Once you pierce the diaphragm, oxygen flow to the brain is reduced. It is important to move to the following step quickly as to reduce hypoxic damage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rrja","text":"Make sure you have good access to the heart and begin the perfusion as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmhlk","text":"Insert tip of butterfly needle into caudal tip of left ventricle (keep the needle shallow within the ventricle - do not pierce the wall of the left atrium)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rtj5","text":"Start pump flowing at the previously determined setting","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9epen","text":"Clip the right atrium using fine scissors","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ug0","text":"At this point blood should begin to flow out of the right atrium. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20bvt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f6bj","text":"The wings of the butterfly needle can be used to hold the needle in place by tucking them under the intestinal organs and/or arranging pins/needles around them. Placing the scissors on top of the needle may also help to hold it in place. Be very careful to keep the tip of the butterfly needle within the left ventricle and do not allow it to fall out or pierce through the atria. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":238,"length":143}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6k7ho","text":"Attach butterfly needle to outlet end of pump tubing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"104i2","text":"Start timer and allow 1X PBS to flow for 4-5 minutes (~20 mL 1X PBS). You should notice the liver turning pale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7k05v","text":"Move the tubing from the 1X PBS to the 4% PFA, without allowing any bubbles into the line. This is achieved by pinching the tubing tightly while moving or stopping the pump for a few seconds to switch solutions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbkdv","text":"Start timer and allow 4% PFA to flow for at least 5 minutes (i.e. 25 mL 4% PFA). During perfusion it is normal for the muscles and tail to begin to twitch/spasm and at the end of the perfusion, the tail should be stiff.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aem6l","text":"Halfway through this step, adjust the tip of the needle slightly to ensure that the cardiac tissue has not stiffened around the tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8eod9","text":"Pull the inlet of the tubing out of solution and run the remainder of the liquid within the tubing to perfuse through the mouse, being sure to remove the needle from the heart before you reach the end to prevent air entering the system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kc53","text":"Unpin the mouse from the perfusion tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etei1","text":"Clean the perfusion lines (if desired, use 'Prime' setting or increase the speed):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au9on","text":"If another mouse will be perfused, clean the lines by running 30-50 mL water through and then prime the lines for the next mouse with at least 10 mL 1X PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2saht","text":"If this is the final mouse, clean the lines by running 50 mL water followed by ~20 mL 70% ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acuaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5eue","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vo2c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7fjif","text":"While running solution through the lines you can harvest the brain from the last perfused animal as described in the following section","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e2oh0","text":"Decapitate mouse; dispose of body.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jt2u","text":"Hold the mouse's nose and manually pull back scalp to reveal top of skull.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5oug7","text":"Remove skull using dissecting tools. There are multiple ways to achieve this, with one option described below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kr8o","text":"Using scissors, cut along the midline (posterior to anterior)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73q6m","text":"Cut across skull (midline going lateral on both sides) at groove between forebrain and cerebellum and at the anterior extent (above olfactory bulbs)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ah3v","text":"Using forceps, peel back each side of the skull with a flicking motion","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df07h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51dh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ebto2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5b0b6","text":"Throughout this process, be careful to not nick or gouge the brain","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nafi","text":"Using a spatula, carefully scoop out the brain and drop into tube of cold 4% PFA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag505","text":"Incubate brain in 4% PFA at   for at least 2 hours and at most overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"con16","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2an9m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3hfnh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E6FA6B60E85811EC9DE9D3CD9C7AE8F1","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1vkt7","text":"Depending on how the tissue will be used, a shorter or longer incubation in PFA is recommended. For some proteins, immunostaining is more effective with LESS fixation (e.g. nuclear proteins such as cFos). Conversely, overnight incubation is recommended to ensure complete fixation before sending tissue to another institution. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoau1","text":"Incubate brain in 30% sucrose in 1X PBS at   until brain sinks (~24-48 hours), indicating that the brain has fully absorbed the sucrose.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7gkds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qmqf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dbfar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"104ra","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1002A700E85B11EC9DE9D3CD9C7AE8F1","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":68}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26mji","text":"If storing the brain in sucrose for longer than 48 hours, add 0.05%  to the sucrose solution; this includes for shipping samples between institutions. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4jc8","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"can_edit":1,"cas_number":"26625-22-8","guid":"43711DBB341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Sodium Azide","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":"S2002","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":null,"vendor":{"affiliation":null,"affiliations":[],"badges":[],"blocked_by_you":false,"blocked_you":false,"hide_following":false,"id":17,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_verified_user":false,"link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Sigma Aldrich","note":null,"research_interests":null,"username":null,"verified":0}},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"reagents"}}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8gpif","text":"Freeze brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"327m8","text":"For long term storage:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sns1","text":"Fill the bottom of an ice bucket with dry ice; you may want to use a hammer to crush the dry ice in order to create a more stable base","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckm5i","text":"Label specimen molds   and fill the bottom of the molds with frozen section medium   ; place on dry ice until frozen","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aobmt","text":"Using a razor blade, trim brain tissue as desired; if possible, cut a flat surface on at least one end (e.g. cut off cerebellum)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cif3r","text":"Place flat end of brain tissue in specimen cup onto frozen medium. The orientation will vary based on the intended target brain region(s) and slice orientation; for coronal sections of the striatum, cut off the cerebellum in the previous step and place the resulting caudal end of the brain onto the frozen medium, with the rostral tip of the brain pointing up","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53ihk","text":"Keeping the specimen cup in the dry ice, fill around the brain with medium until completely covered; be careful to avoid bubbles, especially on the surface of the tissue.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c419","text":"Once the medium has solidified, move the sample to    for long-term storage until the tissue will be further processed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5qdi7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"376038C0363A11EEBB1B55A09C5837C7","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Peel-A-Way® Embedding Mold","rrid":"","sku":"18985-1","url":"https://www.polysciences.com/default/peel-a-waysupsup-embedding-mold-truncated-t8","vendor":{"id":722,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.polysciences.com/","name":"Polysciences, Inc."}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"855378E0363911EEBB1B55A09C5837C7","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Epredia™ Neg-50™ Frozen Section Medium","rrid":"","sku":"22-046-511","url":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/richard-allan-scientific-neg-50-frozen-section-medium/22046511","vendor":{"id":31,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Fisher Scientific"}}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DEA59640F33A11EDB5D17D6F79ED999B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s8td","text":"Mount sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k316","text":"Cover surface of a chuck with a thin layer of frozen section medium","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cllvk","text":"Remove sample from embedding mold and place onto chuck, flat side down","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fr8i","text":"Keep in cooled chamber of cryostat for at least 5 minutes to freeze sample onto chuck","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1v6tg","text":"Mount chuck and adjust slicing conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3ell","text":"Mount chuck in holder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erk2v","text":"Advance sample to the blade; cut off layers of ~100 µm frozen section medium until brain sample is visible","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o0sk","text":"Adjust chuck holder to straighten the tissue with respect to the blade","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br9dr","text":"Adjust thickness to desired value (30-50 µm)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da0dl","text":"Adjust roll plate to ensure sections come off the blade flat","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3tku9","text":"Start collecting tissue at the desired plane:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vnsc","text":"For free floating sections: transfer slices from the cryostat to 1X PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q8c1","text":"For slide mounted sections: touch front surface of slide to the surface of brain sections; use heat from a finger on the back of the slide to encourage attachment of the section. Floating sections in 1X PBS can be mounted on a slide for immunostaining. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adjtp","text":"When the secondary antibody host specie is mouse, the IHC is Mouse on Mouse (MOM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"veev","text":"Steps for IHC from 16-24 are the same, with some modifications stated below, according to manufacturer's directions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gvi5","text":"  \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"daftl","text":"Blocking: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdkmg","text":"Avidin/biotin blocking step (if required): Avidin/Biotin Blocking Kit, Cat. No. SP-2001). Incubate sections with Avidin Solution for 15 minutes. Rinse briefly with buffer, then incubate in the Biotin Solution for 15 minutes. Wash sections 2 x 2 minutes in buffer. This blocking step may be eliminated if suitable controls have determined this step to be unnecessary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnu7c","text":"Mouse Ig blocking step: Incubate sections for 1 hour in working solution of M.O.M. Mouse Ig Blocking Reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buj3m","text":"Protein blocking step: incubate tissue sections for 5 minutes in working solution of M.O.M. diluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pj4d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p3mf","text":"Incubation with primary antibody: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3j8c","text":"Dilute primary antibody in M.O.M. diluent to the appropriate concentration. Incubate section in diluted primary antibody for 30 minutes. Wash sections in PBS as previously described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94utn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70tog","text":"Incubation with secondary antibody:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rtp4","text":"Apply working solution of M.O.M. Biotinylated Anti-Mouse IgG Reagent. Incubate sections for 10 minutes. Wash sections in PBS as previously described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22go","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5f2o","text":"Incubation with avidin- or streptavidin- conjugate:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rof9","text":"Incubate sections in fluorochrome-conjugated Avidin/Streptavidin diluted in 1X PBS for 30 minutes at room temperature in dark. Wash sections in PBS as previously described.
